appDescription.message: Block anyone with specific keywords in their Twitter bio.

blockedWords.message: List all your trigger words (separate by comma):

confirmBlock.message: Ask me to confirm before blocking

intro_text.message: DoucheBlock blocks people who use specific keywords in their Twitter bio. You can specify your choice of keywords below. After that you are all set and ready to use DoucheBlock.

blockCount.message: This extension has blocked $count$ douches for you.

configuring_words.message:
Configuring keyword list

  • Separate each word, word pair, or expression by a comma; they will be evaluated individually against bio text
  • Keyword match is case-insensitive — "abc" matches "AbC", "aBC", etc.
  • regex patterns are supported: here is a cheat sheet
  • IMPORTANT: when regex contains backslashes, you must escape them - example: \b --> \\b
  • occurrence of a keyword anywhere in the bio counts as match (substring match) - specify regex word boundary to match by whole words.

whitelist_help.message:
Whitelisting

When using "confirm before blocking" mode, if you choose not to block someone when alerted, that handle will be added to a whitelist. You will not receive further alerts. You can still always block that user later on twitter.

When using automatic blocking mode, whitelist does not apply.
